title: Increased importance of digital medicine and eHealth during the Covid-19 pandemic.
text: Increased importance of digital medicine and eHealth during the Covid-19 pandemic.

similar.title: Digitally aided telemedicine during the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic to screen oral medicine emergencies.
text: Digitally aided telemedicine during the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic to screen oral medicine emergencies.

A new human coronavirus, known as severe acute respiratory coronavirus 2 syndrome (SARS-CoV-2), emerged at the end of 2019 in Wuhan, China, and we are now facing a pandemic (WHO 2020). The virus has been found in saliva (Meng et al 2020, Sabino et al 2020). In vitro experimental findings suggest that SARS-CoV-2 remained viable in aerosols for 3 hours (van Doremalen et al 2020).
abstract: A new human coronavirus, known as severe acute respiratory coronavirus 2 syndrome (SARS-CoV-2), emerged at the end of 2019 in Wuhan, China, and we are now facing a pandemic (WHO 2020). The virus has been found in saliva (Meng et al 2020, Sabino et al 2020). In vitro experimental findings suggest that SARS-CoV-2 remained viable in aerosols for 3 hours (van Doremalen et al 2020).
